text:
Hi, 
Thanks for the confirmation and the log file content. 
‘Move’ was the key – and that explains why I’ve tried to explain to some pings
that winre.wim needs to be recovered from media if the partition is deleted
before disabling. 
I was surprised to read that winre.wim was on the first partition(left of the
os). 
* Installation media after and including Win10 2004 was supposed to fix/ensure
 Recovery partition was after the Windows partition. 
Also that winre.wim was from partition #5 to C:’s folder location. 
Normally on a GPT disk, the partition numbering is System(#1), MSR(#2),
Windows(#3), Recovery(#4). 
Thanks again for your help. Much appreciated.
%40DS0PR10MB7341.namprd10.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Feedback to Microsoft
metadata.email_text_original:
Hi, 
Thanks for the confirmation and the log file content. 
‘Move’ was the key – and that explains why I’ve tried to explain to some pings
that winre.wim needs to be recovered from media if the partition is deleted

I was surprised to read that winre.wim was on the first partition(left of the
os). 
* Installation media after and including Win10 2004 was supposed to fix/ensure
   Recovery partition was after the Windows partition. 
Also that winre.wim was from partition #5 to C:’s folder location. 
Normally on a GPT disk, the partition numbering is System(#1), MSR(#2),
Windows(#3), Recovery(#4). 
Thanks again for your help. Much appreciated.
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/DS0PR10MB734119C2C8BB4EDF1E413C319E732%40DS0PR10MB7341.namprd10.prod.outlook.com
